sentences: Ma ei tea, kas keegi on seda näinud.
Ükski neist meestest ei oska tantsida.
context: The word 'ükski' in Estonian translates to 'none', 'no one', or 'not any' in English. It is used to indicate the absence of something or someone, functioning as a negative determiner or pronoun. It’s commonly employed when stating that there isn’t even a single instance of something.
